captions.text:
If you watch the Big Bang Theory on CBS television
you see these clueless nerds who are doormats

when ti comes to the opposite sex, right.
And you realize is there any basis in reality?

First of all none of my friends are like that
and all my friends are physicists, right.

Well there is a kernel of truth and that is
some of these individuals may suffer from

something called Asperger's Syndrome which
is a mild form of autism. These people are

clueless when it comes to social interactions.
They don't look you in the eye, for example.

And yet they have fantastic mental and mathematical
capabilities.

We think, for example, that Isaac Newton had
Asperger's. The greatest scientist of all

time was very strange. He had no friends to
speak of. He could not carry a decent conversation

and yet here he was spitting out some of the
greatest theories in the history of science.

Calculus. The Universal Law of Gravitation.
The Theory of Optics. And we think he had

Asperger's Syndrome. Now Asperger's Syndrome
is a mild form of autism and in autism we

have what are called savants. That is people
that have an IQ of maybe 80 but have incredible

mathematical and musical abilities. In fact,
some of these individuals can hear one symphony
and just play it by memory on a piano.

Other people could be in a helicopter, have
a helicopter ride over Manhattan, see the

entire New York harbor and then from memory
sketch the entire harbor. In fact, if you

want to see it go to JFK Airport in New York
City and you will see it as you enter the
international terminal.

So what is it about these people? Well, first
of all a lot of them had injuries to the left

temporal lobe. One individual had a bullet
as a child go right through the left temporal

lobe. Another person dived into a swimming
pool and injured very badly the left temporal

lobe. And these people wound up with incredible
mathematical abilities as a consequence.

And so what is it about their brains? Well
Einstein's brain has actually been preserved.

Einstein when he died had an autopsy in which
case the pathologist stole the brain without

permission of the family. He just realized
that he was sitting next to something historic,

took the brain, took it home with him and
it was sitting in a jar in his home for decades.

He even drove across the country with the
jar inside his trunk.

And there's even a TV special where you can
actually see the cut up brain of Albert Einstein.

And you realize first of all the brain is
a little bit different. You can't tell by

looking at it that it's so remarkably different
but you realize that the connections between

the prefontal cortex and the parietal lobe
-- a connection that is accentuated in people

that do abstract reasoning is thickened. So
there definitely is a difference in the brain

of Einstein. But the question is did it make
Einstein or did Einstein make this change

of the brain? Are champions born or are they
made? That still is not known because people

who exercise mental abilities, mathematical
abilities, they can thicken that part of the
brain themselves.

So we know that people who do well in mathematics
brain scans clearly show that their brains

are slightly different from the average brain.
So in conclusion, we're still children with

regards to understanding how this process
takes place. Tonight don't go home and bang

yourself on the left temporal lobe. We don't
know how it works. We just know that in a

tiny fraction of these cases people with injury
to the left temporal lobe, some of the become
super geniuses.

comments.text:
The doctor who stole Einstein's brain probably made the right decision.
If he did not, it would have been stolen by a grave-robber.
Better a doctor than a black-market dealer.
It's well Known fact that the brain can sense injuries and missing 
functionality in a specific location of the brain and then the brain will 
build the lost functions within another part of the brain.
We see this often in stroke victims.

You should know that many of these theoretical scientists make a career out 
of making outlandish statements of future technological achievements.
The fact is these TS's have not done the analysis. They are simply in the 
mode of making a name for themselves after staying in the regiment of 
school to long - which clearly demonstrates a lack of creative thought.

We can all benefit  from some amount of schooling - but what happens when a 
high level degree is obtained and the person is now burnt out - and cannot 
apply himself to any product development?

I've seen some of these high level degree individuals who never really 
applied themselves but somehow are promoted to a high level position (Space 
shuttle for example) - but they have no experience  - yet they take-on 
critical responsibilities, then processes that they were in charge of - go 
wrong!

The hiring process should always involve multiple interviews and a 
pre-interview meeting during which the tech-leads capture the critical 
interview questions which are relevant to the future tasks involved in the 
product development cycle and responsibilities of the job.

Have you compared Feynman's experience with Kaku's?﻿

comments.text:
We must be careful when saying that a person is socially isolated because 
he/she has poor social skills or autism (see 0:30 seconds into video).  In 
some cases, this is tantamount to blaming the victim.  It seems more 
likely, in many cases, that an individual is being excluded, or perhaps 
ostracized, for cultural reasons.  For instance, a member of a minority 
group might have no friends due to racist attitudes (hopefully less a 
problem these days), or perhaps a member of a religious minority might be 
excluded from a lot of social circles.  Even one's physical appearance can 
cause social exclusion.  Saying that a person is socially isolated because 
of poor social skills, at least in some cases, may be a way of deflecting 
blame away from an uncaring society which deliberately or unconsciously 
excludes certain people who don't measure up.﻿

comments.author: Chuichupachichi

comments.text:
+Cameron Seebach
{See Nylon-eating bacteria}

In case you haven't heard, scientists have also discovered bacteria that 
have adapted to eating asphalt in order to survive. At this very moment, 
the street in front of your house is being eaten by bacteria

However, the thing that is truly astonishing, is that evolutionists 
continue to believe that these gastronomically infinite, bacterial 
adaptations are, somehow, an argument in favor of evolutionary theory

Consider the hypothetical scenario in which the global environment would 
change so as to kill all lifeforms on Earth, except one. Which one, from 
amongst all lifeforms, would be the sole survivor?

Well, considering that, currently, bacteria survive within every 
environment that exists within Earth's atmosphere, it is, without a doubt, 
bacteria that would be the sole survivors

This is, yet, one more explanation that falsifies theory of evolution. 
Since, according to the postulations of the theory, bacteria, being single 
cell organisms, should possess the least degree of survivability. While the 
greater the degree of complexity possessed by multicellular organisms, the 
greater the degree of survivability that they would also possess

Bacteria are the "KINGS OF SURVIVAL"... due to the fact that, amongst other 
reasons, they adapt to extremely hostile environments by becoming enabled 
to eat nearly anything that is available for consumption... such as, nylon 
& asphalt

All the while, continuing to exist as single celled bacteria... due to the 
unbreakable, hard rule of Biology...

...Each must come forth after their own kind
comments.author: Chuichupachichi

comments.text:
+Cameron Seebach
 {You seem to be denying the evolution of new species}

This statement is one which cannot be responded to with the simplicity of 
either yes or no. That's due to the fact that a problem is caused by the 
word "species". In fact, within Biology, it's referred to as the "species 
problem"

Notice, I said that humans can't give birth to anything other than humans 
and the example I used for animals was that canines can't give birth to 
anything other than canines.

Nevertheless, a variety of different canines can be, and have been, 
descended from a particularly specific canine. All canines have descended 
from Canis Lupus (Wolf). This is simply the result of micro evolution, 
i.e., variation...which does occur. Therefor, considering that Taxonomy 
categorizes Wolf, Coyote, Fox, Dingo etc. as each one a distinct species, 
then my response is, no, I don't deny the (micro) evolution of new species.

However, evolutionists claim that "speciation" occurs, with the implication 
being that it proves macro evolution. Thus, whenever the word "species" is 
used in this manner, then my response is, yes, I do deny the evolution of 
new species

But my two different responses to the same word is not causing the problem. 
But rather, evolutionists are causing the problem by using the word 
species, while remaining oblivious to the "species problem"

This is what you need to know...evolutionists explain that whenever a 
population of organisms separate from a greater population, biological 
changes may occur while living in a different environment. Thus, if members 
of the break away population attempt to interbreed with members of the 
original, parent population, they'll be incapable, due to the biological 
changes. Or if they can successfully interbreed, but cannot produce viable 
offspring, then it is said, from either scenario, that "speciation" has 
occurred

This is the explanation of "speciation" and the same explanation is 
presented as the standardized definition of the word "species". However, 
the problem is that there exist animals, such as, various species of 
canines that can interbreed and produce viable offspring. Also, every 
example presented by evolutionists as the occurrence of speciation, is 
merely another occurrence of variation. The Salamanders are still 
Salamanders etc. etc. etc.

The fact is that the validity of "speciation" is completely dependent upon 
the existence of a standardized definition of the word "species". No such 
definition exists and within the scientific field of Biology, this is known 
as the "species problem"
comments.author: Chuichupachichi

comments.text:
I'm not understanding the relevance of this "hard rule" to your argument. 
You seem to be denying the evolution of new species, which while it can be 
a long process, does actually happen. See Nylon-eating bacteria, for 
example. Am I misunderstanding you?
comments.author: Cameron Seebach

comments.text:
+Cameron Seebach
{but don't difficult circumstances, like those facing "modern" societies 
throughout time, cause evolution to work in the favor of intelligence?}

The theory of evolution itself, doesn't claim to work in the favor of 
anything. It postulates that after a number of random mutations have become 
part of a greater population, a particular mutational morphologic change 
may enable its recipient organism to survive a new, hostile environment 
that has killed the entire rest of the population

The fact is, mutations are reproductive defects. Thus, they are not better 
suited, than are correctly reproduced organisms, for overcoming life 
threatening, biological adversities. Mutations are, themselves, a 
biological adversity

This is why, for as long as man has been observing mutants within nature, 
every time its been observed that they're the first to die. They don't 
survive even ideal environmental conditions...much less, conditions hostile 
to their species

Listen, everyone on Earth knows that there doesn't exist even one human 
that can give birth to something other than a human. Every reproductive 
human can give birth to only another human and nothing else. It's a hard 
rule of Biology & it cannot be broken. Biologists know in detail, the 
specific reasons why reproductive systems are subject to this hard rule

Therefor now, consider a pair of human mates that reproduce, They, being 
humans, are subject to this hard rule of Biology. Thus, they necessarily 
give birth to a human. That offspring, being human, is also subject to the 
same, unbreakable, hard rule of Biology. Thus, he necessarily reproduces 
another human offspring. Now we're up to the third generation and the same 
hard rule applies to him because of his humanity

You can continue that reproductive line for thousands or millions of years 
and the results will never change because the cycle is one of continual 
self perpetuation. This unbreakable, hard rule of Biology continually 
perpetuates itself upon every generation, causing the neverending 
perpetuation of only human offspring

This reproductive hard rule applies, not only to humans, but also, to all 
other biological organisms. Canines cannot give birth to something other 
than Canines...etc. etc etc.

Thus, we find, scientifically, that each must come forth after their own 
kind
comments.author: Chuichupachichi

comments.text:
+Chuichupachichi I don't understand your assertion that the "theory of 
evolution, by design, destroys acumen and makes human minds stupid." I 
could understand if the circumstances of life were easier - but don't 
difficult circumstances, like those facing "modern" societies throughout 
time, cause evolution to work in the favor of intelligence? Any papers or 
evidence you could cite for your interpretation?
comments.author: Cameron Seebach

comments.text:
+James Burton You know about alcohol correct? Alcohol is a poison, yet 
other poisons can not effect our brains?

Now, i am not saying poisons cause autism / aspies, what i am saying is 
that they cause symptoms of which are commonly mislabelled as autism. 

Neither am i condoning the shield of feminism, i'm simply pointing out that 
such a study would never happen so long as women rule the world. 

Btw, the correlation between intelligence and brainsize has been proven 
several times. 

I also never stated that aspies was soley a male trait, however, aspies in 
men and women overall show much different traits, and the brains of which 
are also significantly different, much as the brains of men and women are 
significantly different. 

Lastly, aspies is very different from autism, and i also do not condone the 
decision to plop it into ASD and call it autism. I believe this decision is 
mainly a government action to hide the effects of food and water poisoning. 
No sane scientist would dare lower the resolution of data.
comments.author: HotNoob

comments.text:
To be honest I do not believe Autism in the classical sense and Asperger's 
are the same condition, granted they may share many characteristics. Also I 
was only referring to Asperger's, as I have little knowledge of classical 
Autism. 

This being the case I have seen no evidence for any relationship between 
the incidents you listed and the formation of neural connections, which is 
the crux of Asperger's syndrome. How is it that the brain of a normal 
person (simplistic nomenclature) can be altered in such a drastic way by 
vaccine or fluoride poisoning? Do you honestly believe that vaccines or 
fluoride poisoning can alter a person's brain THAT much given that the 
neural connections related to Aspergers have already been formed?

In terms of feminism... it should be kept out of science. I watched a video 
where Richard Dawkins mocks (deservedly) a feminist article on science. I'd 
also like to point out that a bigger brain does not necessarily mean a more 
intelligent being, nor that Aspergers occurs solely in males.
comments.author: James Burton

comments.text:
Most people who are labelled as autistic are so because of some sort of 
damage, IE, heavy metal poisoning, fluoride poisoning, trauma to the 
head... ect..

This needs to stop.

Also, take a look at the Neanderthal Autism Theory. 

Btw, if every autistic were to be a result of over exposer to testosterone, 
then every person born with autism would have an extremely wide face; but 
this is not always the case. 

We would also need to prove a link between testosterone and brain size, as 
those born with autism have a 10% larger brain, which feminists would never 
let us do, as it would be further proving that men are smarter then women. 
( i'm only assuming that it hasnt been proven because it would make 
feminists world wide blow the fuck up )

comments.text:
People with amazing mathematical abilities are often underachievers in math 
class. Einstein had trouble with basic math as a child but was still a 
mathematical genius. Some geniuses were not the best students in college or 
struggled with basic algebra. It's a difference in cognition. ﻿

ideas with mathematics.

I had a bad injury to the left side of my head 15 yrs ago.Shortly after I 
developed an obsession with mathematics. I started teaching myself algebra 
and within a period of time I was up to multivariable calculus , vector 
analysis, partial differential equations , linear algebra, fourier analysis 
, even tensor analysis.So many areas and I'm still teaching myself more , I 
also draw,and play 3 musical instruments . I thank the Lord that my skills 
have become solid. I don't consider myself a super genius just and average 
intelligent person ,although people tend to see in me what I wish I really 
was..... ﻿

comments.author: TheRushingHero

comments.text:
Honestly, I'm glad I have aspergers.  For anyone else that has it and is 
reading this, you can make it socially.  It might not come as easy as it 
does for others, but it will happen.  I'll never forget the time in my 4th 
grade astronomy class when I said that Saturn could fit inside of a jar.  
Even the teacher was laughing, but I knew I was right.  It didn't get any 
better till the end of high school though, but I ended up in the top of my 
class in college while in a fraternity.﻿

comments.author: Siretch

comments.text:
I find that show rather silly and tasteless.  Its kind of like having fun 
with those will mental or psychological disabilites and that its not only 
OK to do so, but right to take advantage of it at such people's expense.  
No, I don't think I'm being over sensitive.  Its an observation and a fair 
one.  Its the return of the 'circus geek', Todd Browning's 'pin heads', 
Irkle and Gleason's "Crazy Googanhan".  But we cannot be social facists and 
thought police. We cannot force "social acceptability".  It is still a 
guaranteed right of Free Speech to "hurt someone's feelings" and not 'hate 
speech" (whatever that means).  And education to 'sensivity' and draconian 
political law- a form of hate itself- backing it is wrong, wrong and 
wrong.  I am one who has that Aspbergers dioagnosis and have done things 
about it to make myself happier in this world with friends, love, 
experiences, gaining social graces, to improving interpersonal 
communications, to sharing my talents and contrtibuting what I could.  Now, 
if we could only get off this kick of renaming 'social epithets' with 
'diagnostic eponyms' and visa versa, it would be a great beginning.  We 
must also remember that Prof. Kaku is a Physicist and neither a 
Psychologist or Neurologist.  His is yet, as mine is, merely his opinion.  
(And I am a huge fan).﻿

comments.text:
My theory: most of these socially awkward nerds/geniuses are simply INTPs 
and INTJs (2 of the 16 Myers-Briggs personality types). Each of the the 16 
types utilizes different parts of the brain. The INTPs (Einstein, Kant, 
Smith, Darwin) and INTJs (Newton, Hawking, Tesla) use, more heavily than 
other people, the parts of the brain responsible for abstract reasoning and 
insight. One only needs to look at the 'celebrities' of each of the 16 
types to see that almost ALL famous/important discoveries were made by 
either an INTP or INTJ.﻿
